goals.question: What is the relationship between x1 and y1?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of x1 and y1
goals.rationale: This helps to identify if there is any correlation between the two variables.

goals.question: What is the mean of x2 and y2?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of x2 and y2
goals.rationale: This helps to compare the mean values of the two variables.

goals.question: What is the distribution of x3?
goals.rationale: This helps to identify the frequency distribution of the variable.

goals.question: What is the relationship between x4 and y4?
goals.visualization: Line chart of x4 and y4
goals.rationale: This helps to identify any trends or patterns in the data over time.

goals.question: What is the correlation between x1 and y2?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of x1 and y2
goals.rationale: This helps to identify if there is any correlation between the two variables.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.scatterplot(data=data, x='x1', y='y1')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between x1 and y1?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    mean_x2 = data['x2'].mean()
    mean_y2 = data['y2'].mean()
    mean_data = pd.DataFrame({'Variable': ['x2', 'y2'], 'Mean': [mean_x2, mean_y2]})
    
    ax = sns.barplot(x='Variable', y='Mean', data=mean_data, palette='viridis')
    plt.axhline(mean_x2, color='blue', linestyle='--', label=f'Mean x2: {mean_x2:.2f}')
    plt.axhline(mean_y2, color='green', linestyle='--', label=f'Mean y2: {mean_y2:.2f}')
    plt.title('What is the mean of x2 and y2?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='x3', kde=True, color='blue', label='x3')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of x3?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.lineplot(x='x4', y='y4', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the relationship between x4 and y4?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.scatterplot(data=data, x='x1', y='y2')
    plt.title('What is the correlation between x1 and y2?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
